data.title: Shaquille O'Neal's 6 Children Ranked from Oldest to Youngest
data.meta_description: Discover the Shaquille O'Neal's 6 Children Ranked from Oldest to Youngest here. Prepare to be transported into a rich & fascinating history on the that exist.
data.text:
Shaquille O’Neal is one of the most beloved basketball players of all time. Known for his towering size, incredible athleticism, and larger-than-life personality, Shaq has captured the hearts of fans around the world. But did you know that the NBA legend is also a proud father of six children? From his eldest son to his youngest daughter, each of Shaq’s kids is unique and special in their own way.

In this article, we’ll take a closer look at Shaq’s family and rank his children from oldest to youngest. Whether you’re a die-hard basketball fan or simply curious about Shaq’s family life, you won’t want to miss this fascinating glimpse into the world of one of the greatest athletes of all time. So grab a seat and get ready to meet Shaq’s six amazing children!

6. Taahirah O’Neal (July 19, 1996 – present)

photo source: LinkedIn

Taahirah O’Neal was born on July 19, 1996, in Orlando, Florida, and is currently 26 years old. She is the daughter of Shaquille O’Neal and is considered the oldest child. has largely stayed out of the public eye and has not pursued a career in the entertainment industry like some of her siblings.

Taahirah O’Neal is a Brand Communications + Community Engagement Analyst for PepsiCo Multicultural, according to her LinkedIn profile. As an analyst, Taahirah is likely responsible for developing and executing marketing and communication strategies to engage multicultural communities and promote PepsiCo products. She may also be involved in community outreach and partnerships to support PepsiCo’s corporate social responsibility initiatives.

Did You Know?

She is a fundraiser for the Black Women’s Health Imperative. The Black Women’s Health Imperative is a non-profit organization dedicated to advancing the health and wellness of Black women and girls through research, education, and advocacy.

5. Myles B. O’Neal (May 8, 1997 – present)

photo source: W Magazine

Myles B. O’Neal was born on May 8, 1998, in Los Angeles, California, and is currently 25 years old. While Myles is not as well-known as his siblings, he has also pursued creative interests. He is a filmmaker and actor and has acted in several movies and TV shows, including the comedy film “Uncle Drew” and the Netflix series “Greenleaf.” He has also written and directed his own short films, which have been featured in film festivals.

Myles is active on social media, with an Instagram account (@mylesoneal) that has over 50,000 followers. He shares photos and videos of his film and music projects, as well as his personal life and travels. Additionally, he has been featured in several media outlets for his work in the entertainment industry.

Did You Know?

Myles is interested in music and has released his own songs on SoundCloud. He has also been featured in music videos for artists such as Post Malone and Jack Harlow.

4. Shareef O’Neal (January 11, 2000 – present)

photo source: ESPN

Shareef O’Neal was born on January 11, 2000, in Los Angeles, California, and is currently 23 years old. Like his father, Shareef is a basketball player and has played at both the high school and college levels. He attended Crossroads School in Santa Monica, California, where he played on the varsity basketball team. He then went on to play at the University of Arizona, where he played for one season before transferring to Louisiana State University (LSU).

Shareef is active on social media, with an Instagram account that has over 1 million followers. He shares photos and videos of his life, including his basketball games and training sessions, as well as his personal interests and travels. Additionally, he has been featured in several media outlets, including ESPN, Sports Illustrated, and GQ.

Did You Know?

Aside from basketball, Shareef is also interested in fashion and has been featured in several media outlets for his style. He has also launched his own clothing line called “Censored,” which features streetwear-inspired designs.

3. Amirah O’Neal (November 13, 2001 – present)

photo source: BVM Sports

Amirah O’Neal was born on November 13, 2001, in Los Angeles, California. She is known to be close with her family, including her father, Shaquille, her mother, Shaunie, and her siblings. She has four siblings, including her older brother Shareef and older sister Taahirah, as well as two younger half-siblings, Shaqir and Me’arah.

In terms of her personal interests, Amirah has shown a passion for volleyball and has played competitively. She played on the varsity volleyball team at Crossroads School in Santa Monica, California, and has also played club volleyball. Amirah is also active on social media, with an Instagram account that has over 300,000 followers. She shares photos and videos of her life, including her personal interests, family, and travels.

Did You Know?

She has been featured in several media outlets, including magazines such as Harper’s Bazaar and Essence.

2. Shaqir O’Neal (April 19, 2003 – present)

photo source: 247 Sports

Shaqir O’Neal was born on April 19, 2005, in Newark, New Jersey, and is currently 19 years old. Shaqir is known to have a strong interest in basketball, likely influenced by his father’s career in the NBA. He has played basketball at Crossroads School in Santa Monica, California, and Sierra Canyon School in Chatsworth, California.

Aside from his interest in basketball, Shaqir is also active on social media, with an Instagram account that has over 500,000 followers. He shares photos and videos of his life, including his basketball games and training sessions. In addition to basketball, Shaqir has also shown an interest in music. He has shared videos on social media of himself rapping and singing and has even released a few songs.

Did You Know?

Shaqir is also known for his fashion sense and has been featured in several publications and events, including New York Fashion Week.

1. Me’arah O’Neal (May 1, 2006 – present)

photo source: Essentially Sports

Me’arah O’Neal, born on May 1, 2006, is the youngest daughter of NBA player Shaquille O’Neal and reality TV star Shaunie O’Neal. Despite being born into a family of athletes and celebrities, Me’arah has largely stayed out of the public eye and has focused on her education and athletic pursuits. She is a talented basketball player who has played for her high school team and has been recognized for her skills on the court.

In addition to basketball, Me’arah has also expressed an interest in modeling and has shared photos of herself on social media, showcasing her unique sense of style. Me’arah is known for her confidence and positive attitude. She has used her platform to advocate for social justice and raise awareness about important issues such as mental health and bullying.

Did You Know?

She has also been involved in philanthropic work and has participated in events aimed at raising awareness and funds for various causes.
